thread.title: Coronation Street fans praise Kym Marsh and Jane Danson for 'intense' and 'heartbreaking' scenes
thread.title_full: Coronation Street fans praise Kym Marsh and Jane Danson for 'intense' and 'heartbreaking' scenes

author: Katie Fitzpatrick
title: Coronation Street fans praise Kym Marsh and Jane Danson for 'intense' and 'heartbreaking' scenes
text:
Coronation Street fans praise Kym Marsh and Jane Danson for 'intense' and 'heartbreaking' scenes Their Corrie characters Michelle and Leanne came to blows tonight when Steve's baby secret was revealed Share Get soaps   Thank you for subscribing!   
Corrie fans heaped praise on Kym Marsh and Jane Danson for dramatic scenes which saw Michelle Connor punch Leanne Battersby in the face, reports the Manchester Evening News . 
Michelle gave new mum Leanne a bloodied nose after discovering the truth that husband Steve had fathered their neighbour’s baby son Oliver. 
The truth was blurted out in the Bistro as Steve held Oliver in his arms at a party to celebrate the arrival of Leanne’s newborn son, who she planned to have raised by her partner Nick Tilsley. Both stars were praised for their performances Jane's character Leanne got bloodied Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Steve McDonald reveals he's the father of Oliver on Corrie Share this video 
As Steve held the baby he whispered “I’m so sorry. This is my son.” Read More Steve McDonald drops HUGE Coronation Street baby bombshell as he holds his secret son 
Michelle then confronted her friend Leanne in the Bistro saying “I thought you were my friend.” 
Leanne explained that Steve, played by Simon Gregson, had kept their affair a scene because he wanted to protect his marriage to Michelle, who is grieving the loss of their son Ruairi who died last month. 
But she snapped when Leanne said “you lost Ruairi. Don’t lose Steve”, giving Leanne a right hook to the face . 
Fan @SamSmithFan tweeted: “Wow these Michelle and Leanne scenes are intense” 
Viewer @soproudmum said: “I just want to give Michelle a big hug #Corrie so heartbreaking” 
And @emily_moffattx tweeted: “Kym Marsh is just simply amazing #Corrie” 
Jane tweeted after the gripping double bill: “Wow thank you.i havent see the eps tonight but so thrilled you enjoyed them @itvcorrie. Me and @msm4rsh really enjoyed filming those scenes.” Like us on Facebook
